benchmark_details.name: WIKES (Wiki Entity Summarization Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: WIKES is a comprehensive benchmark for entity summarization that combines graph algorithms and NLP models using data from Wikidata and Wikipedia, allowing for automatic summary generation without human annotation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To foster research on entity summarization and provide a tool to generate arbitrary-size datasets for evaluating summarization models.

data.source: Data generated from Wikidata and Wikipedia XML dump files.
data.size: Over 500,000 entities in various dataset sizes (small, medium, large).

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated based on precision and recall; MAP measures the ranking quality of predicted summaries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 and MAP scores indicate better performance in entity summarization.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated against existing benchmarks like ESBM.
methodology.validation: Datasets are validated using a train-test-validation split of 70%-15%-15%.
